body:
You probably have auto reconnect enabled.
Either disable it or set less reconnect attempts. 4 will have it stop more quickly.
Okay, but does the manual stop button not overwrite the auto reconnect attempts? That's what happens on Wirecast for example.
This should be resolved in the new OBS 29 beta. @pkviet should be able to confirm.

Oh i thought the user was already testing in beta.
@saltarob test the beta. It should fix it. I wrote something to that end
Still the same on OBS 29 beta1. Stream button gets stuck in the "connecting" state.
May I ask something else? Is the SRT Stream monitored in the OBS stats? Will dropped frames in the SRT stream show up in the stats? Thank you.
Can confirm, an SRT server denying new connections from OBS leaves the output in reconnecting mode and the UI prevents the user from cancelling.

issue.title: obs-ffmpeg: Allow srt stream to disconnect after timeout

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
Fixes #7848
Currently OBS_OUTPUT_INVALID_STREAM is emitted when a wrong password is used. This commit expands the signal emission to case of timeouts.

### Motivation and Context
Bugfix is good.

### How Has This Been Tested?
Tested that a wrong srt URL leads to emission of OBS_OUTPUT_INVALID_STREAM and that the stream is stopped with the 
corresponding error message.

### Types of changes
 - Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) 

### Checklist:
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.

body: Fix here https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/pull/7857 ; test the artefact once CI is done with building.

Thank you. There is now this popup window which informs me that it can't connect to the server. Does this mean the automatic reconnect is bypassed now? Most of the time I am controlling OBS through the WebSockets. I think the popup Window can't be accessed through the WebSockets. Therefore the "Start Stream" button will be blocked. Can this popup Window be deactivated? I thought about stopping it manually with a second click on the stream button, which is showing "connecting". And as long as you don't cancel it manually it can retry automatically according the settings. That can be helpful if there is a short interruption from which it could recover automatically through reconnecting. And if you notice that the reconnection doesn't work you can stop it manually and check the settings etc.  Thank you.

> Thank you. There is now this popup window which informs me that it can't connect to the server. Does this mean the automatic reconnect is bypassed now? Most of the time I am controlling OBS through the WebSockets. I think the popup Window can't be accessed through the WebSockets. Therefore the "Start Stream" button will be blocked. Can this popup Window be deactivated? I thought about stopping it manually with a second click on the stream button, which is showing "connecting". And as long as you don't cancel it manually it can retry automatically according the settings. That can be helpful if there is a short interruption from which it could recover automatically through reconnecting. And if you notice that the reconnection doesn't work you can stop it manually and check the settings etc. Thank you.

- automatic reconnect is stopped. This is in line with what happens with rtmp (just try with a faulty rtmp address): the same message is shown and auto-reconnect is also stopped.

- No the popup window either for rtmp or now for srt can not be deactivated. You have to click manually to dismiss the window.

- The popup won't show up in case of initial successful connection and later a network issue; the auto-reconnect will be triggered.

I understand that the popup window doesn't work with your current setup but there's no alternative, I'm afraid. I won't do anything different from rtmp. And your suggestion of stopping the stream manually won't work; the only option will be to fully exit obs (unless, if you were a dev, you  make a custom build to prevent the popups. If this is critical to you, consider hiring someone.)
Closing now as I consider this fixed.

Okay I understand. Thank you so much. If it doesn't show up after the initial successful connection then it should be fine in most cases. And exit OBS would be the workaround in case the popup window is blocking the Start Stream button.
Pop up dialogs have no effect on obs-wrbaocket functionality.

Oh great. Just tested it with Touch Portal. OBS just opens another popup window. As often you click the "Start Streaming" button through WebSockets as many popup windows you get :-) Thank you so much.
